messages.content: સપ્તાહ ૧ મા સોઈલ પાંદડી તે શુ છે
messages.en: What's the soil leaf in Week 1
messages.standalone_question: What is soil pH in week 1?
messages.standalone_en: What is soil pH in week 1?
messages.content_transliterated: saptah bhai ma soil pandadi te shoe che

messages.content:
સપ્તાહ ૧ માં સોઈલ પાંદડી (Petiole Testing) એ પાંદડાના નમૂનાઓને પરીક્ષણ કરવાનો પ્રક્રિયા છે, જે છોડની પોષણની જરૂરિયાતો અને આરોગ્યની સ્થિતિને સમજવા માટે ઉપયોગી છે. આ પરીક્ષણ દ્વારા, તમે જાણી શકો છો કે છોડને કયા પોષક તત્વોની જરૂર છે અને તે કઈ માત્રામાં છે. 

આ માહિતી આધારિત, તમે યોગ્ય ખાતરનો ઉપયોગ કરી શકો છો, જે તમારા પાકની વૃદ્ધિ અને ઉત્પાદનને સુધારવા માટે મદદરૂપ થાય છે. 

પાકના વિકાસના વિવિધ તબક્કાઓમાં, પાંદડીના નમૂનાઓ લેવાનું મહત્વપૂર્ણ છે, ખાસ કરીને જ્યારે પાકની પોષણની જરૂરિયાતો બદલાય છે.
messages.en:
Petiole testing at week 1 is the process of testing leaf samples, which is useful for understanding the nutritional needs and health status of the plant. Through this test, you can know what nutrients the plant needs and in what amount it is. 

Based on this information, you can use the right fertilizer, which is helpful in improving the growth and production of your crop. 

At different stages of crop development, it is important to take leaf samples, especially when the nutritional needs of the crop change.

messages.en: Hi

messages.standalone_en: What would you like to talk about today?

messages.content: नमस्कार, समधान! तुम्हाला कशाबद्दल मदतीची आवश्यकता आहे?
messages.en: Hello, Samdhaan! What do you need help with?

messages.content: Jugni
messages.en: Jugni

messages.content: आपका सवाल क्या है? कृपया बताएं, मैं आपकी कृषि संबंधी सहायता करने के लिए यहाँ हूँ।
messages.en: What is your question? Please tell me, I'm here to help you with your agriculture.

messages.content: Kiya bimari
messages.en: Kiya bimari

messages.content: आपकी फसल में संभावित बीमारियों की पहचान करने के लिए, कृपया मुझे बताएं कि आप किस फसल की बात कर रहे हैं। मैं आपको सही जानकारी देने में मदद कर सकूँगी।
messages.en: To identify possible diseases in your crop, please tell me which crop you are referring to. I will be able to help you with the right information.

messages.content: Jugni
messages.en: Jugni

messages.content:
आपकी फसल में "जुगनी" (जिसे आमतौर पर "जुगनी" या "जुगनी कीट" कहा जाता है) की समस्या हो सकती है। यह कीट फसलों को नुकसान पहुंचा सकता है। 

यदि आप अपनी फसल की स्थिति की जांच करना चाहते हैं या किसी विशेष समस्या के बारे में जानकारी चाहते हैं, तो कृपया अधिक विवरण दें। क्या आप किसी विशेष फसल की बीमारी या कीट के बारे में जानना चाहते हैं?
messages.en:
Your crop may have a problem with "jugni" (commonly called "jugni" or "jugni pest"). This pest can damage crops. 

If you would like to check the status of your crop or would like information about a particular problem, please provide more details. Do you want to know about a particular crop disease or pest?

messages.content: Yess
messages.en: Yess
messages.standalone_question: Are you looking for information about a specific crop disease or pest?
messages.standalone_en: Are you looking for information about a specific crop disease or pest?

tools:
analyse_crop_image  
Gets the analysis of the uploaded crop image for any diseases or pests.

get_disease_pest_schedule  
Retrieves the farmer's current and past pesticide-related spray recommendations with spray details, based on dates. Dates are mandatory.
faq:
Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: How does the device predict diseases and pests?
A: It captures data from different parameters using sensors and analyzes it using various agronomical algorithms, including different models for all diseases and pests.
   Each disease and pest has a specific etymology, which is the suitable environment for its incidence.

messages.content:
आपकी फसल में "जुगनी" की समस्या के लिए, मैं आपको कीट नियंत्रण के लिए स्प्रे शेड्यूल की जानकारी प्रदान कर सकती हूँ। 

कृपया मुझे बताएं कि आप किस प्लॉट के लिए स्प्रे शेड्यूल जानना चाहते हैं: "कोराली प्लॉट" या "बड़का आलिमुद्दीन वेदर यूनिट"?
messages.en:
For the problem of "Jugni" in your crop, I can provide you with information on the spray schedule for pest control. 

Please tell me which plot you would like to know the spray schedule for: "Korali Plot" or "Barka Alimudin Weather Unit"?

messages.content: Badkaalimudin
messages.en: Badkalimudin
messages.standalone_question: What information do you need regarding the spray schedule for the "Bardka Alimuddin Weather Unit"?
messages.standalone_en: What information do you need regarding the spray schedule for the "Bardka Alimuddin Weather Unit"?

tools:
check_spray_conditions  
Gets the spray condition forecast for the next few hours for the farmer's plots and returns the condition for each hour as GOOD, MODERATE, or WORST, based on deltaT, VPD, and rainfall conditions.

get_disease_pest_schedule  
Retrieves the farmer's current and past pesticide-related spray recommendations with spray details, based on dates. Dates are mandatory.
faq:
Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: How do I maintain the weather station for Kairo?
A: Clean the rain gauge and solar radiation sensor every three months with a damp cloth, and spray the array lightly with insecticide if needed.

messages.content:
इस सप्ताह (27 जनवरी से 3 फरवरी 2025) के लिए "बड़का आलिमुद्दीन वेदर यूनिट" प्लॉट में किसी भी कीट या बीमारी के लिए स्प्रे की कोई सिफारिश नहीं है। 

यदि आपको किसी विशेष समस्या का सामना करना पड़ रहा है, तो कृपया और जानकारी दें।
messages.en:
There is no recommendation of spray for any pests or diseases in the "Barka Alimudin Weather Unit" plot for this week (27th January to 3rd February 2025). 

If you are facing any particular issues, please provide more information.

messages.standalone_question: What specific issue are you facing with your crop?
messages.standalone_en: What specific issue are you facing with your crop?

tools:
analyse_crop_image  
Gets the analysis of the uploaded crop image for any diseases or pests.
faq:
Q: Why should I water my crop?
A: Watering your crop is essential to maintain the right moisture balance for healthy growth. Fyllo provides soil monitoring sensors that can provide irrigation precise requirement forecasting. The forecast will also provide the details for why and when you should irrigate.

messages.content: आपका सवाल स्पष्ट नहीं है। कृपया बताएं कि आप किस विषय पर जानकारी चाहते हैं या किस प्रकार की सहायता की आवश्यकता है। मैं आपकी मदद करने के लिए यहाँ हूँ।
messages.en: Your question is not clear. Please state what information you are looking for or what kind of assistance is needed. I'm here to help you.

messages.content: More of same <user uploaded image for analysis at 'shivajibodhkefarmguavakairo/2025-01-27-1737948830547.jpg'>
messages.en: More of same <user uploaded image for analysis at 'shivajibodhkefarmguavakairo/2025-01-27-1737948830547.jpg'>
messages.standalone_question: What can you tell me about the image I uploaded?
messages.standalone_en: What can you tell me about the image I uploaded?

messages.content:
The analysis of the uploaded image indicates that the leaves show a powdery or dusty appearance, which may suggest the presence of pests or a fungal issue. There are also signs of potential damage, such as discoloration and irregular textures.

### Recommendations:
1. **Monitor Closely**: Keep a close eye on the plants for any signs of pests or diseases.
2. **Improve Image Quality**: For future analyses, try to:
   - Focus on the affected areas.
   - Capture images from a closer distance.
   - Ensure good lighting to highlight any issues.

If you suspect a specific problem or need further assistance, please provide more details or a clearer image.

messages.standalone_en: What is causing the browning in the uploaded image?

messages.content:
The uploaded image appears to show a soil sample or a soil-related item rather than the crop itself. To provide a proper analysis, I would need a clearer image of the crop, particularly focusing on the affected areas.

### Recommendations:
1. **Capture a Closer Image**: Take a photo of the crop, especially the leaves or fruits that are showing browning.
2. **Ensure Good Lighting**: Good lighting will help in identifying any potential diseases or pests.

Please upload a clearer image for further analysis.

messages.content: What are these white spots on my Guava leaves<user uploaded image for analysis at 'shivajibodhkefarmguavakairo/2025-01-27-1737948479546.jpg'>
messages.en: What are these white spots on my Guava leaves<user uploaded image for analysis at 'shivajibodhkefarmguavakairo/2025-01-27-1737948479546.jpg'>
messages.standalone_question: What could be the cause of the white spots on my guava leaves?
messages.standalone_en: What could be the cause of the white spots on my guava leaves?

messages.content:
The white spots on your Guava leaves may be indicative of aphid infestations. Here are some general recommendations for managing aphids:

1. **Insecticidal Soap**: This can help control aphid populations without harming beneficial insects.
2. **Neem Oil**: A natural pesticide that disrupts the life cycle of pests.
3. **Horticultural Oil**: Effective in smothering pests.

Apply these treatments in the early morning or late evening to minimize harm to beneficial insects and avoid leaf burn. Regular monitoring of the plants is essential to catch any further infestations early. 

If you have a clearer image focusing on the affected areas, it could help in providing more precise recommendations in the future.
messages.en:
The white spots on your Guava leaves may be indicative of aphid infestations. Here are some general recommendations for managing aphids:

1. **Insecticidal Soap**: This can help control aphid populations without harming beneficial insects.
2. **Neem Oil**: A natural pesticide that disrupts the life cycle of pests.
3. **Horticultural Oil**: Effective in smothering pests.

Apply these treatments in the early morning or late evening to minimize harm to beneficial insects and avoid leaf burn. Regular monitoring of the plants is essential to catch any further infestations early. 

If you have a clearer image focusing on the affected areas, it could help in providing more precise recommendations in the future.
